fr.eikasus.objectsmyfriends.model.dal.implementations

Class GenericDAOImpl<T,U>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.eikasus.objectsmyfriends.model.dal.implementations.GenericDAOImpl<T,U>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BidDAOImpl, CategoryDAOImpl, ImageDAOImpl, ItemDAOImpl, PickupDAOImpl, UserDAOImpl

    public abstract class GenericDAOImpl<T,U>
extends java.lang.Object
    Support for Data Access Objects.

    This abstract class is used to add meaningfully methods for implementing data access objects as easy as possible with a minimum of redondent code. This class also provide methods for accessible objects from database that are common for all entities.

    This is the implementation for database.

    See Also:
    findByProperty(String, Object), find(), find(Object), save(Object), update(Object), refresh(Object), detach(Object), deleteByProperty(String, Object), delete(Object), deleteById(Object)

    • Method Detail

      • findByProperty

        public java.util.List<T> findByProperty(java.lang.String property,
                                        java.lang.Object value)
                                 throws ModelException
        Retrieve entities by specific property.

        This method is used to retrieve an entity or many from the database whose one of their property is equal to the value supplied in parameter.

        Parameters:
        property - Name of the property.
        value - Value of this property.
        Returns:
        List found entities.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • find

        public java.util.List<T> find()
                       throws ModelException
        Retrieve all the entities.

        This method is used to retrieve all entities from the database. Be aware that this can take time and memory consomption if many entities need to be retrieved.

        Returns:
        List of entities.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • find

        public T find(U identifier)
       throws ModelException
        Retrieve one entity.

        This method is used to retrieve an entity form the database whose identifier is supplied in parameter.

        Parameters:
        identifier - Identifier of the entity to find.
        Returns:
        Asked entity.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • save

        public void save(T entity)
          throws ModelException
        Save an entity into the database.

        The entity supplied in parameter is stored in the database. Its identifier should be zero, otherwise an error occurs.

        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to save into the database.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • update

        public void update(T entity)
            throws ModelException
        Update an entity into the database.

        The entity supplied in parameter is updated in the database. Its identifier should not be zero, otherwise an error occurs.

        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to update into the database.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • refresh

        public void refresh(T entity)
             throws ModelException
        Refresh an entity from the database.

        The entity supplied in parameter is refreshed from the database. Its identifier should not be zero, otherwise an error occurs.

        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to refresh from the database.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • detach

        public void detach(T entity)
            throws ModelException
        Detach an entity from the database.

        The entity supplied in parameter is detached from the database, which means all changes made to this entity will not be reported to the database. This also means that another find operation for the same object will create another instance.

        Parameters:
        entity - The entity to detach from the database.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • deleteByProperty

        public void deleteByProperty(java.lang.String property,
                             java.lang.Object value)
                      throws ModelException
        Delete entities by specific property.

        This method is used to delete an entity or many from the database whose one of their property is equal to the value supplied in parameter.

        NO PERSISTENCE CONTEXT SHOULD BE ACTIVE TO USE THIS METHOD.

        Parameters:
        property - Name of the property.
        value - Value of this property.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem.

      • delete

        Parameters:

      • deleteById

        public void deleteById(U identifier)
                throws ModelException
        Delete an entity from the database.

        The entity whose identifier is supplied in parameter is deleted from the database.

      • execute

        protected void execute(boolean transaction,
                       ModelError errorCode,
                       ResultVoid action)
                throws ModelException
        Execute an action related to the database.

        This method is used whenever an action need to be performed with the database. The action represent the code that will be executed inside a transaction or not. This method is used to avoid redondance in code.

        Parameters:
        transaction - Whether to use a transaction to perform the desired action.
        errorCode - Error returned with the ModelException object in case of problem.
        action - Action to realize.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem, contain the error code supplied in parameter.

      • execute

        protected T execute(boolean transaction,
                    ModelError errorCode,
                    ResultObject<T> action)
             throws ModelException
        Execute an action related to the database.

        This method is used whenever an action need to be performed with the database. The action represent the code that will be executed inside a transaction or not. This method is used to avoid redondance in code.

        Parameters:
        transaction - Whether to use a transaction to perform the desired action.
        errorCode - Error returned with the ModelException object in case of problem.
        action - Action to realize.
        Returns:
        Result of the operation, depending on the action performed.
        Throws:
        ModelException - In case of problem, contain the error code supplied in parameter.
